Alison Davis Gerstell and David Stoll Smith were married on Friday by the Rev. Constance Jordan-Haas at the Noroton Presbyterian Church in Darien, Conn.

Mrs. Smith, 38, is a vice president for sales in the 20th-century-art department at Christie's in New York. She and the bridegroom are board members of Pathways Inc. in Greenwich, Conn., which provides services to the mentally ill. The bride graduated from Connecticut College and Sotheby's works of art course in London.

She is a daughter of A. Frederick Gerstell of Los Angeles and Barbara K. Gerstell of Vero Beach, Fla. Her father retired as the chairman of the CalMat Corporation in Los Angeles, which quarried and made materials for paving roads and for buildings.

Mr. Smith, 43, is a vice president and the chief financial officer of the Dover Corporation, which makes assembly equipment for semiconductors, products for oil and gas extraction and other machinery in New York. He graduated from Columbia University and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania.

He is a son of Jill Smith and the Rev. Elton Osman Smith, both of Washington. His father is the acting director of development and special assistant to the dean at the Washington National Cathedral. He is also the dean emeritus of St. Paul's Cathedral in Buffalo.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bride's.
